channel.title: New Graphics Card
channel.description:
Ok, im having trouble deciding which card i should get. I can stick with nvidia and get the 7600gt http://www.newegg.com/Product/CustRatingReview.asp?Item=N82E16814130283 which is reliable, company i like, secure.
Or I could get an ATI x1800GTO http://www.newegg.com/product/product.asp?item=N82E16814161004 which can play games better resolution, a little better, slower initial clock, but can be upgraded really easy to 16 pipes instead of 12 which should even out the playing field but voids warrenty. I know i'll overclock it, but the void warrenty will be tough. What do you guys think?

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @darkest_mage darkest_mage
item.description:
@darkest_mage wrote:

go with nvidia fool

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Gah its so hard to choose, i love invidia but im leaning twords the ati one. i havnt had good performance experiance with nvidia …

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

I go with nvidia as a matter of personal preference (I’ve had some bad experiences with ATI cards, though lots of other people love them). Plus it’s a $70 price difference, which you could go buy yourself another game or something with.

And if you want a warranty, obviously go with the one where you’re not planning to void it from the start.

Read full topic

item.title: New Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I’ve got an X850XT, and I can say I like that one much better than the nVidia counterpart.

Read full topic
